author: Special Correspondent
text:
Auroville’s Sankalpa Art Journeys is hosting an expressive arts therapy symposium here from February 19 to 21.

According to Sankalpa founder and art therapist Krupa Jhaveri, the sessions will be led by a panel of six national and international art therapists and social workers.

The three-day symposium will involve experiential-based, co-creation workshops on the themes of exploring identity from self to other, community art exchange and group interaction through various art forms.

The six presenters, apart from Ms. Jhaveri, are Sangeeta Prasad, Susan Ainlay Anand and Jennie Kristel from the U.S., Oihika Chakrabarti (Kolkata) and Brinda Jacob-Janvrin (Bengaluru).

The event is co-hosted by Prasad Family Foundation and Manahkshetra Foundation.

Discussion

The concluding day will also feature a half-day discussion on forming the Indian Art Therapy Association.

Those interested can fill the application available onhttp://bit.ly/1HOMRDc.
title: Symposium on arts therapy from Feb. 19
